message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank's Enterprise Survey and the Doing Business database to explore the relationship between regulatory environment and firm productivity.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Survey", "Doing Business database"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Mexican Family Life Survey and find that access to formal credit institutions, such as banks, is positively associated with measures of financial inclusion.", "dataset": ["Mexican Family Life Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using county-level data from the USDA Census of Agriculture and the National Agricultural Statistics Service’s Census of Aquaculture, we estimate the impact of climate change on catfish production in the southern United States.", "dataset": ["USDA Census of Agriculture", "National Agricultural Statistics Service’s Census of Aquaculture"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from Pew Research Center and Gallup World Poll to investigate the role of social media usage in shaping public opinion on climate change.", "dataset": ["Pew Research Center", "Gallup World Poll"], "topic": ["Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Values Survey and the European Social Survey, we examine cross-national variation in support for public-private partnerships across 27 countries in Europe.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "European Social Survey"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "This report draws on multiple datasets, including the International Debt Statistics database, to provide a comprehensive analysis of trends and challenges facing developing countries with increasing levels of debt.", "dataset": ["International Debt Statistics database"], "topic": ["Debt"]}, {"sentence": "Combining data from the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics and the Global Forest Watch, we assess how land tenure regimes affect deforestation rates in the Brazilian Amazon.", "dataset": ["Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics", "Global Forest Watch"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the World Economic Forum's Global Gender Gap Report and the International Labour Organization to analyze gender disparities in labor force participation across 149 countries.", "dataset": ["World Economic Forum's Global Gender Gap Report", "International Labour Organization"], "topic": ["Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This study leverages data from the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series and American Community Survey to investigate the impact of transportation policy on job accessibility for low-income workers in urban areas.", "dataset": ["Integrated Public Use Microdata Series", "American Community Survey"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Transport", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey and the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System, we examine the relationship between food insecurity and chronic diseases among U.S. adults.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey", "Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System"], "topic": ["Health", "Nutrition"]}]
